Key Arguments: The legislation will erode the fundamental human right of freedom of speech.
Freedom of speech is essential for discovering truth and facilitating dialogue.
The government should not be the arbiter of truth.
The bill could lead to self-censorship among Australians with legitimate opinions.
Notable Quotes: Freedom of speech is the bedrock of a free and fair society and forms the foundation of democracy.
The proposed bill will effectively halt this essential dialogue.
Setting up the government as the arbiter of truth is not the answer.
A country which, if this bill is allowed to pass, will cause Australians with legitimate opinions and concerns to self-censor.
